Parameters: int: the index of the media player track which contains this subtitle data.
long: the start time in microsecond for the subtitle data
long: the duration in microsecond for the subtitle data
byte: the data array for the subtitle data. It should not be null. No data copying is made. This value must never be null.
SubtitleData(int,long,long,byte[]).FullName: public SubtitleData (int trackIndex, long startTimeUs, long durationUs, byte[] data)

Returns: the display start time for the subtitle
getStartTimeUs().Description: Returns the media time at which the subtitle should be displayed, expressed in microseconds.

Returns: the encoded subtitle data This value will never be null.
getData().Description: Returns the encoded data for the subtitle content. Encoding format depends on the subtitle type, refer to

Returns: an index in the array returned by @B_android#media#MediaPlayer#getTrackInfo_E@.
getTrackIndex().Description: Returns the index of the media player track which contains this subtitle data.

Returns: the display duration for the subtitle
getDurationUs().Description: Returns the duration in microsecond during which the subtitle should be displayed.

ClassDesc: Class encapsulating subtitle data, as received through the @B_android#media#MediaPlayer#OnSubtitleDataListener_E@ interface. The subtitle data includes: the track index the start time (in microseconds) of the data the duration (in microseconds) of the data the actual data. The data is stored in a byte-array, and is encoded in one of the supported in-band subtitle formats. The subtitle encoding is determined by the MIME type of the @B_android#media#MediaPlayer#TrackInfo_E@ of the subtitle track, one of @B_android#media#MediaFormat#MIMETYPE_TEXT_CEA_608_E@, @B_android#media#MediaFormat#MIMETYPE_TEXT_CEA_708_E@, @B_android#media#MediaFormat#MIMETYPE_TEXT_VTT_E@. Here is an example of iterating over the tracks of a @B_android#media#MediaPlayer_E@, and checking which encoding is used for the subtitle tracks: See @B_android#media#MediaPlayer#setOnSubtitleDataListener_E@ to receive subtitle data from a MediaPlayer object.
